intro: Orchis traunsteineri var. schurii, commonly known as the Schur's Traunsteiner's orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Central Europe. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of pale pink to purple flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist woodlands and requires specific soil conditions to thrive. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is pollinated by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
